page.title: 06Social Concerns
page.content: Social Concern ============== The Women's Royal Voluntary Service organise many services, one being meals on wheels. the meals are prepared at a local school and are placed in individual containers which are thn housed in a "Hot-Lock" which is a galvanised container about 2'6" square which is kept hot by charcoal in a lower section of the container. The meals are delivered twice a week to elderly and infirm people,the majority of whom live on their own. There are an average of sixteen drivers and helpers who call at their houses, serve the meals and make sure they are alright in every respect. A lunch club is held once a week for the more ambulant senior citizens enabling them to meet each othe and hae a meal together.
